description: Erection of a two storey and basement side extension and opening up of existing light wells.
decision_conditions:
FORMAL DECISION:

The Planning Inspectorate allow the appeal and grant planning permission for the erection of a two storey and basement side extension and opening up of existing lightwells at 32 Haverstock Street, London, N1 8DL, in accordance with the terms of the application (reference: P041606) dated 30th June 2004 and the plans submitted therewith subject to the following conditions:

1.  The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this decision.

2.  Notwithstanding details shown on the submitted plans, no development shall take place until details of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

3.  No development shall take place until large scale details of the joinery items to be used in the exterior of the extension hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

4.  No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, rainwater pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipes or conduits shall be fixed to the street or side elevations of the extension hereby permitted, other than those expressly authorised by this permission.

5.  The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until details of arrangements for the storage of refuse have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved arrangement shall be completed before the development hereby permitted is first occupied and thereafter permanently retained.
